page.title: 14EMPLOYMENT - General/Stud
page.content: There are very few jobs to be found in the block it self.Most of the people who live there,work either in Stafford or the West Midland towns.Many are self employed or in a profession.A small number are employed on the local farms or forestry land.A few are employed in shops/catering/public houses and garages in the area. The CHASE STUD is on Old Camp road.It has 16 acres divided into two paddocks.There are thirteen stables which includes a feed house to store food.There is a tack room for the riding things.There is a garage,hay barn and a ring where the horses are trained.There are 6 race horses;Outlaw Tixall Boy, Incandescence,Aldro, Covent Garden and Miss Millinski. Mr White bought the Stud in 1984.There are 10 Hereford heifers as well. (Lisa Robinson Age 11)
